messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Moving from Unschooling to Adulthood  was    what to...
messages.msgSnippet: That s so funny, Pam.   Aislinn and Elysia, 8 and 6, have some pretty grand plans about excavating our backyard for their family houses.  They plan on
messages.messageBody:
That's so funny, Pam. Aislinn and Elysia, 8 and 6, have some pretty
grand plans about excavating our backyard for their family houses. They
plan on underground houses with tunnels between each of theirs and ours.
I love fantasizing about this, too. I would be so unhappy if they
moved away. Heidi

Genant2@... wrote:

>In a message dated 7/8/04 2:25:58 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
>diane@... writes:
>
>
>
>>The whole idea of leaving home at 18 or 21ish IS deeply ingrained in our
>>society.
>>
>>
>
>The other day my son Dallen who is 9 said that when he gets older he wants to
>clear some land in our back acreage and build a house on our property to live
>in. The thought of that is nice. That my son would be that close. But we
>have never really bought into the concept of moving our at 18 or 21.
>
>It was very touching,
>Pam
>
>
